intro: Sloanea duckei, commonly known as the white sloanea, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often glabrous and leathery in texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Sloanea duckei is also known for its ornamental value, particularly due to its attractive, waxy white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland tropical forests.
